oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Substrate bias effect on cycling induced performance degradation of flash EEPROMs
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MAHAPATRA, S
SHUKURI, S
BUDE, JD
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: pld programming
flash memories
integrated circuit reliability
integrated memory circuits
substrates
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cycling induced performance degradation of flash EEPROMs has been reported for VB=0 and VB<0 programming operation. Compared to VB=0, VB<0 programming shows lower interface degradation for identical cumulative charge fluence (for program) during repetitive program/erase cycling. Reduction in programming gate current has been found to be lower for VB<0 operation under identical interface damage as the VB=0 case. As a consequence, programming under VB<0 condition has been found to cause lower degradation of programming time and programmed VT due to cycling.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Proceedings of the 16th International Conference on VLSI Design, New Delhi, India, 4-8 January 2003, 223-226
